#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=In total Flame travelled 6 fire dancers , including Flames choreographer , producer and creative directors , along with 2 safety crew from Queenstown , where we are based , to Wellington .
#Text=This was a very unique event .
#Text=How did it differ from your previous experience ?
#Text=It was a great event to be involved in because the bands were such big names and legends , one way or another ! ! !
#Text=And of course the thousands of people to perform to over 2 nights … to Rock music ! !
#Text=In these ways it was a unique experience , definitely performing to original kiwi rock music…we often fire dance to the likes of Fat Boy Slim & prodigy …

#Text=We have performed throughout New Zealand with our biggest audience probably being the Qtn Winter Fest openings in 2005 & 2006 but I think the Rock2Wgtn was bigger than that ... . And it was different to feel part of a whole production , with the stunt guys and zombie girls and the NZ bands and the big time bands and the dragon ! ! ? …
#Text=Often we ’ve been a stand alone performance so it felt good to have a role , alongside others , in creating a rocking experience for the rock enthusiasts .
#Text=Was it hard to choreograph a show around the rock music that was on offer ?
#Text=Our fire dance performances are usually fully choreographed routines , from start to finish of one track , with an assortment of fire spinning devices …
#Text=for this gig we requested the bands set list , in order of their play .
#Text=We familiarised ourselves with their music and used combinations of toys that would work best with each song , according to rhythms , tempo and feel .
#Text=For example , the up beat rock songs were great for the fire hula hoop or staff or poi , where as the more tragic rock ballads leaned towards a slow seductive fire whip .
#Text=We skipped the songs that did n’t inspire us and went for it , having heaps of fun , with those songs that did .
#Text=The combining improvised fire dance with tight choreography on the chorus seemed to work best for us .
#Text=It flowed naturally and looked effective in performance .

#Text=We discovered rock music , at times , had quite complex beats , making some songs harder to choreograph than others , in such instances we avoided choreography and let the improvised fire dance roll ! !
#Text=Our aim was to use toys that had the biggest fire for the hottest most blazing effect .
#Text=We had well over a month of rehersing two nights a week , to get to know the songs , the choreography and practise improvised rock dance moves .
#Text=So while still being flexible for any last minute changes we were ready to rock with prepared toys , routines and dancers specifically for each song .
